Also can someone plz set up the Team tank battle?

I'll see if I can, if I have time. :/

I'll see if I can, if I have time. :/

Make sure to pick a wide open place that is flat for several kilometers so people will be able to space out their tanks.

To pick teams, we will just go on whoever setups next i.e you set up so you are team 1, next person sets up they are team 2, and so on.

Make sure to pick a wide open place that is flat for several kilometers so people will be able to space out their tanks.

To pick teams, we will just go on whoever setups next i.e you set up so you are team 1, next person sets up they are team 2, and so on.

Ok, though we may need to re-balance teams before starting. I'm thinking around KSC 2 or another interesting locale on Kerbin... lemme take a VTOL out for a spin, and I'll find a good area.

EDIT!:

I may have found a suitable candidate for a battlefield:

It's on Kerbin, and is completely isolated from the other landmasses.

The island (which I've dubbed "Jeb's Pirate Island") also has a small lake, slightly varied terrain, and a cool terrain-scatter forest.

So, what do you guys think? As for rules, I think 2-3 players per team, with 4 tanks each. (Besides normal NBC rules in the OP)

-2 Light (smaller tanks, like the Maverick, LAT-1, Stub, etc.)

-1 Medium (mid-size tanks like the MBT-3A2, Maelstrom, etc.)

-1 Large/Heavy (anything that's not a P1000 Ratte. I'm looking at you, Zekes. )

I can't do much more tonight, as I'm awfully busy IRL. Tomorrow, I'll see if I can setup my tanks provided ya'll are OK with this.

ALSO: coords for a central dropzone via hyperedit: 31.7 : 11

The new main MBT of the Southern Mercantile Coalition. Glory to the traders.

List of players for the team tank battle ATM:

-Me

-Zamo

-astecarmyman

-Spartwo might be in, depending on how long setup takes, as he's really busy.

-SuperHappySquid

*daemon has not replied to my PM yet*

In any case, I'll set up this afternoon/evening when I get a chance, and here's how the moves will take place^

The first player set up is Team 1, second is Team 2, third Team 1, etc.

The last player set up (who will be likely on team 2) moves first, along the lines of the standard battle rules on page 1. Players will then take turns in reverse order, eventually cycling back to the last player, until one team is clearly the winner.

This is a TDM style battle, so the goal is simple: take out the other team's tanks. To help make this simpler, I ask that when you set up your tanks ingame, please remember to add a (T1) or (T2) at the end of each of your tank's names.

Edited March 24, 2015 by 8bitgammers

Ok, I've set-up the team tank battle and placed my tanks. As of now, I am the first set-up, and I'm on team 1 of 2.

The next player will be on team 2 of 2, then the next player after him/her will be on team 1, until a pair of balanced teams is fully setup in-save.

Rules:

Standard, plus:

-2 tanks:

-1 light (roughly ten tons or less in terms of mass, and this is a semi-flexible rule), and one medium*.

*Each team may have one player with a "heavy" tank instead of a medium one.*

-Tanks must be placed at least 3km away from other player's tanks before the combat starts.

-The last player to place their tanks goes first.

-Flipped tanks may be righted by teammates during that teammate's turn, without losing a turn.

-No K-exploit weapons (i.e. Kraken "plasma", -drives, bombs, etc.)

Player List:

-Me

-Zamo

-astecarmyman

-SuperHappySquid

-daemonCaptrix

-Spartwo will join if he can, as he's quite busy.

My tanks:

-1x MU LAT-1 V2, callsign Funco (Light)

-1x MU MBT-3 A2 w/ spec ops kit and Cruise TOW, callsign Ichiroku (Medium)

Map:

Mark your tanks once you've set up.

.persist: https://www.dropbox.com/s/cvtq924hjhitoog/NBC-IslandWarfare.sfs?dl=0

SuperHappySquid, you're up.

- - - Updated - - -

Also, I did some weapon upgrades on my tanks...

A LAT-1 V2 firing a mini-HEAT round for a range test...

An MU Cruise TOW zeroes in on its target, boost system primed and ready...
